result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Clifton L Jones Jr

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed:  State's Motion in Limine.

Defendant Clifton L Jones Jr not in court, in custody.  Attorney Connor Romenesko appeared by video for Clifton L Jones Jr.  Attorney Grace M. Gall appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.  Court set final pretrial and jury trial dates upon request from the defense.  Court ordered all substantive motions to be filed by 9-30-2022 and all responses to be filed by 10-28-2022 or they will be deemed waived.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Connor Romenesko in court, defendant Clifton L Jones not in court, in custody.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for status conference.  Defense counsel requests another status date.  Court set date as requested. Case adjourned to Branch 40.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/a8cc2343-9b62-c309-778f-fa846faecb6a.  Status conference scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Connor Romenesko in court, defendant Clifton L Jones not in court, in custody at MSDF.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defense requests a status date.  Court set the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Clifton L Jones in court with Attorney Connor Romenesko; both appear by video.  Defendant Clifton L Jones in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer M. Anderson. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Attorney Connor Romenesko

Defendant Clifton L Jones in court, in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. Court adjourns case for an attorney to be appointed. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.

Defendant Clifton L Jones in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Defendant Clifton L Jones in custody.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Clifton L Jones appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.
